value.title: 2 ways to reduce your Power BI dataset size and speed up refresh
value.excerpt: Adam shows you two things to reduce your Power BI dataset size. These are both things he commonly sees with Power BI reports and could potentially save you a lot of space and improve refresh times along with report performance.  Data reduction techniques for import modeling: https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/guidance/import-modeling-data-reduction

value.title: Get started with the Power BI Gateway
value.excerpt: Get to know what the Power BI Gateway is along with how to get it setup for scheduled refresh of imported data.  Free Gateway Cube Sheet: https://guyinacu.be/gatewaystartpdf  Gateway Documentation: https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/service-gateway-onprem  Gateway sizing: https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/guidance/gateway-onprem-sizing

value.title: Power BI Bookmarks, Selections and Toggles
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick shows how you can use bookmarks and selections to create interesting reports to show different aspects of your data. He also shows a very cool way to change between those selections that he picked up from one of his customers.  Bookmarks - https://powerbi.microsoft.com/en-us/documentation/powerbi-desktop-bookmarks/

value.title: 20 tricks to finally master the Matrix visualization in Power BI!!
value.excerpt: The matrix visualization has over 100 configuration options, and some of the most basic functionality, like hiding subtotals is not so easy to discover.  In today's video, I will show you 20 things you can do on the matrix that will take that visualization to the next level.  Did I miss any? Let me know

value.title: How to Create Power BI TOP N Report (Power BI Top 10 / Top N Filter)

value.title: Measures vs. calculated columns in DAX and Power BI
value.excerpt: What are the differences between measures and calculated columns in DAX and Power BI? All the answers in this short video. Do you want to know more? Start with Introducing to DAX free course: https://www.sqlbi.com/p/introducing-dax-video-course/ Go deeper with Mastering DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/p/mastering-dax-video-course/

value.title: How to filter a table to show only most recent date by group in Power Query
value.excerpt: It is a best practice to load in Power Bi only the data that you need. In today's video, I will show you how you can filter a table by the last date available. value.title: Sort month name chronologically in Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: Have you struggled when dragging month name to a chart axis and it is sorted alphabetically in Power BI Desktop? Adam shows you how you can change the sort order to be chronologically instead of alphabetically. This technique can also be used for other categorical columns in Power BI.  ******** LET'S

value.title: Prepare data for analysis
value.excerpt: Students will explore Power Query as they learn to extract data from different data sources and choose a storage mode and connectivity type. They will learn to profile, clean, and load data into Power BI in preparation for modeling their data.

topItems.title: Get data in Power BI
topItems.excerpt: You will learn how to retrieve data from a wide variety of data sources, including Microsoft Excel, relational databases, and NoSQL data stores. You will also learn how to improve performance while retrieving data.

topItems.title: Clean, transform, and load data in Power BI
topItems.excerpt: Power Query has an incredible amount of features that are dedicated to helping you clean and prepare your data for analysis. You will learn how to simplify a complicated model, change data types, rename objects, and pivot data. You will also learn how to profile columns so that you know which columns have the valuable data that you‚Äôre seeking for deeper analytics.

value.title: Get data with Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: How can you find, collect, and clean data from different sources? Power BI is a tool for making sense of your data. You will learn tricks to make data-gathering easier.

value.title: Get data in Power BI
value.excerpt: You will learn how to retrieve data from a wide variety of data sources, including Microsoft Excel, relational databases, and NoSQL data stores. You will also learn how to improve performance while retrieving data.

value.title: #41 Understanding relationships in Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: You normally build relationships in Power BI (connect two tables together) so you can work with the data in both tables as if they were a single table.  In this video you will learn how to create relationships, understand what and how to use the advance options and troubleshoot the most common problems.

value.title: How to create and use a Power BI Hierarchy
value.excerpt: Patrick looks at how to create and use a Power BI Hierarchy within Power BI Desktop. Hierarchies can help to provide correct data usage within your Power BI reports. value.title: Intro to Python in Power BI
value.excerpt: Using Python and curious how to use it with Power BI? Patrick explores how you can do just that! Python + Power BI can be a powerful combination. value.title: STOP publishing your Power BI report until you do these 5 things!
value.excerpt: Your Power BI report could be slow and not functional. Publishing to Power BI may also show you your ugly baby. value.title: Using the SELECTEDVALUE function in DAX
value.excerpt: Learn how the SELECTEDVALUE DAX function simplifies the syntax required in many scenarios where you need to read a single value selected in the filter context. value.title: Power BI Slicers vs Filters - which will you choose?
value.excerpt: Adam picks up on David Eldersveld's blog about Power BI slicers versus filters and looks at if slicers are even needed now. The filter pane can satisfy a majority of scenarios. There are a few that it can't. Which Power BI feature will you choose?  David Eldersveld blog - https://dataveld.com/2019/01/18/are-power-bi-slicers-still-relevant-with-the-new-filter-pane/
